newsitem.title: JAPAN: EPA minister says some firms can cope with 105 yen.
newsitem.headline: EPA minister says some firms can cope with 105 yen.

text.p: Japan Economic Planning Agency (EPA) Minister Taro Aso told a news conference on Friday that there are some companies which can cope with an exchange rate of 105 yen to the dollar.

Asked how the current exchange rate of about 115 yen to the dollar affects the economy, Aso also said there were some firms which could probably cope with a dollar rate of 105 yen but other companies would not be able to cope with that rate.
"There are companies which can do business at a currency rate of 105 yen, but I wonder, on average, if others can do that as well," he said.
"When I make such a statement, it's often the case that small and medium-sized companies complain about such a statement," he added.
